description: AI-assisted creative writing workflow executed within Claude Code using Task tool for subagent spawning

1.name: NPE Extraction
1.description: Extract Narrative Physics Engine from existing outline to capture generic writing preferences

2.name: Dramatic Spine Extraction
2.description: Extract the high-level dramatic spine (tension axes, dominant energy, emotional progression) from story, character, and world concepts

3.name: Theme Extraction
3.description: Extract core thematic questions (not statements) that the story explores. Identifies ONE main theme question and max 2 secondary theme questions.

4.name: Character Development
4.description: Develop detailed character profiles from character concepts using the Main Character Template. Supports multiple characters - spawns parallel subagents for each character in input file.

5.name: World Constraints Extraction
5.description: Extract functional world constraints that limit movement, choices, and possibilities. Not a travel guideâ€”focuses on geography, culture, resources, power structures, and vibes parameters that force better plotting.

6.name: Relationship Mapping
6.description: Identify and extract important relationships from concept files and character profiles. Filters to main/primary relationships that drive plot, character arcs, or themes. Generates relationship mapping for architecture step.

7.name: Relationship Architecture
7.description: Define relationship architecture for key character pairings. Supports multiple relationships - spawns parallel subagents for each relationship in mapping. Creates specs for consistent, evolving interactions across three-act structure.

usage: Tell Claude Code: 'Run step 1', 'Run step 2', or 'Run the book design workflow'

notes.orchestration: Claude Code acts as the orchestrator, spawning subagents via Task tool
notes.context_minimal: Each subagent only loads files specified in 'inputs' and 'depends_on'
notes.parallel_processing: Steps with parallel_processing:true will parse input files and spawn multiple subagents in parallel (e.g., Step 2 spawns one agent per character)
notes.adding_steps: Add new step objects with incremental numbering
